title: Good atmosphere
review: With the best view and edge of Naini lake you can get the blessings of nature with goddess Naini devi very popular in Nainital.

title: nice .. one of the least crowded shakti peeth i have been :)
review: very good vibes...went there around 8am in the morning and there was almost no crowd.. we took our time to visit all the worship places..the main temple is very charged and the there is a worship place if you take the stairs also : very good vibes there..  its was pretty cold when we went there.. the temple provide some special slippers to walk around ...the lake view is awesome too..

title: One of the most revered Goddess of Kumaon region, Uttrakhand, India
review: Location of the temple just over looking the Nainital lake. Amazing must visit temple in down town Nainital.

title: Nice temple
review: i went with my wife there we were just wondering there suddenly we saw temple and decided to go inside. its really big and nice.

title: The Goddess of Nainital
review: The city of Nainital is named after goddess Naina Devi. It’s a must see holy place for people who have faith. There’s a very lively local market right outside the temple. The overall vibe of the place is very positive and you can spend a nice evening with the family.

title: very pious place
review: dodess naina Devi temple is ICON and sacred place for Nainital.temple is nicely clean maintained as sacred religious palce

title: Serene surrounding
review: Located beside the lake and charming in nature. Ther is a Tibetan market and Gurdwara beside it. It’s walking distance from Mall road.

title: Divine experience with great view of the naini lake - must visit
review: This temple always pulls me whenver I am in Nainital. Plus it offers great view of the entire naini lake pressed between the huge mountains.

title: naina devi temple
review: the local deity of nainital, the temple is situated in one corner of naini lake. every tourist to nainital visits this.

title: Nice temple and Darshan
review: The temple is situated near the market place next to the Naini Lake. Its a small temple, but nicely maintained.It is not a shaktipeetha but might have been a Locally important temple or like a Gramdeivat. Darshan took less than 15 mins and road is straight without any star case or a steep climb

title: Temple near naini lake.
review: One can feel that this temple has a special bond with the lake. Spectacular views of the lake from temple.

title: One of Shaktipith of Devi Sati at Nainital
review: This is one of the Shaktipith of Devi Sati. It says the eyes of devi fallen over here and which in sanskrit called "Nayan" and from there the Nainital name has came. The lake is shaped like a eye and it's said it's the place where the eye felled. The temple is very beautiful and you can get a peace of mind. Situated just beside the famous Nainital Lake. The view of lake from the  temple is also very good. You can offer your Prayer to devi over here. It's surrounded by Tibetan Market and other shopping areas. A must visit place at Nainital. Jai Maa Naina Devi.

title: Goddess of Nainital!!
review: This temple is devoted to Maa Naina devi and it is very close to Mall Road, naini Lake and  Bhotia Market.

title: Greatest
review: It is a huge temple situated near Nani Lake, whose beauty is very unique. This is a peaceful place. Believe it, after going here, your heart will be easy for ever.

title: Religious
review: The temple is small and just located at the end of mall road by the lake..It has a great religious importance for locals.

title: Beautiful Temple
review: This is a very old temple on the lake Naini. It is a very beautiful temple of Lake Naini. There is a good market to shop around the temple.

title: A very revered and popular temple
review: This temple is one of the main attraction when you are in Nainital. During Navratras, the crowd is huge but during the season also there is large crowd of devotees.

title: FIRST AND FOREMOST PLACE TO VISIT IN NAINITAL
review: The most important place to visit in Nainital is to visit the Naina Devi Mandir. From the last 20 yrs whenever I have visited Nainital this temple is always on my list.

title: Nainital The City of the Maa Shakti peethas
review: Nainital is a famous tourist hill station situated at an altitude of 2084 meters above the sea level, located at the Kumaon region of Uttarakhand state. This is also called the Lake District of India. Nainital is the most favorite travel destination among the International & Domestic tourist. The name of the Nainital is originated from its Famous lake “Naini Lake” which has a shape of Eye. Nainital is the Shakti peethas according to the Hindu Mythology.

title: Goddess by the side of the lake
review: The temple is situated just at the end of the lake facing the waters of the lake. It is very clean and well maintained.

title: Beautiful Temple at the Bank of Nainital Lake!
review: The temple is perfectly located at the bank of Nainital lake, near the Mallital area of Nainital.Temple complex is very clean and well maintained. It's not just for worships, you can sit there and relax feeling the fresh air coming from the lakeside.

title: Holy Naina Devi temple
review: Naina Devi temple is one of the several pith of Maa Kaali.  Naina Devi temple came into existence when Lord Shiva was carrying the corpse of Sati and her right eye fell to the ground where the temple currently stands.

title: Holy.......
review: At the time when you enter  you feel extremely energetic and full off purity and feel like an attachment with Almighty......Holy and Haven.....

title: Soul Soothing Experience
review: This should be the first place to visit after any traveller hits Nainital to make an auspicious beginning to the trip. The temple is beautiful. Joining hands before Goddess Naina Devi gives one peace of mind and energy to keep travelling. It is also, in essence, your welcome to Nainital by the local diety. The entry to this temple is free.

title: A ideal place to start your visit to Nainital
review: This temple & it's colourful surroundings was our first place of visit & we found that it was well maintained, neat & clean. We offered our prayers & took a number of photos

title: Good temple to visit.
review: Its one of the must see place in Nainital and is located next to nainital lake one must be here if you are in Nainital.

title: Temple
review: Naina Devi- the temple where the Right eye of Sati Devi is supossed to have fallen. The temple structure was rebuilt post the 1860 landslide. Very well maintained place. since it was a Deepavali day, there was absolutely noone in the Temple and darshan was pretty fast. The Temple is on the bank of the Nainital lake and we can stand by the fence watching the swimming fishes. Though the fish is not supossed to be fed, the temple prasad can be offered to fishes - rather the fish wait for it. Be careful not to drop in the plastic cover in the lake after feeding the rice flakes. Dustbins are kept the for the same

title: Beautiful Temple at a beautiful location
review: Visited Naina Devi temple with family during our November 18 trip to Nainital. Visit was was soothing & Nice feeling away from hectic site seeing schedule. Well maintained temple.

title: Divine
review: the temple is near to lake and you must visit once to pay your respect. its a normal  temple like any other city but near to lake and spending some time will give you peace.

title: temple
review: nestled between gurudwara and mosque. small temple with great views of lake. in the middle of market and stalls.

title: Worship
review: Beautiful temple of maa naina devi..on the bank of naini jheel... this temple of maa is one of the 64 shaktipeeths, eyes(nayan) of sati was fallen here.. that's why naina devi is named and place is called nainital.. calm and peaceful place..

title: Must visit
review: Its a must visit place in Nainital . .. superb veiw .. full of resturents around the place .. but local guide are too much annoying ..

title: Holy place in nainital
review: it just near the mall road and naini lake. Not very much crowded and one of the main attraction in nainital.

title: Nice temple 🕍
review: Nice temple next to beautiful Nainital lake.great view from temple and it is next to market. With huge parking.

title: One of the cleanest temples
review: We visited the temple during durgapuja and were astonished to see the beauty in the night . The temple indeed is quite clean and being in the bank of lake add to its beauty.

title: DURGA PUJA AT NAINA DEVI TEMPLE
review: Our joy found no bounds - Durga Puja was being celebrated in the same way it is celebrated in Bengal at Nainital - a large image of Ma Durga with her whole family - just beside the Naina Devi Temple. Could not ask for anything more. We paid obeisance to Hanumanji, Naina Devi and Ma Durga and her family.

title: Nice tranquility.....
review: This is one of the best temple in NAINITAL. Just beside the lake. Must visit in evening time to see the lake from the temple premises. As per the story available in website maa Parvati eye fall here. Naina and lake or Tall together that's why this place name Naitall. Must visit... If you are in Naintal it is just besiee the bhutia market.

title: A Holy Place located on the Bank of Naini Lake !
review: Naina Devi Temple is located on the Bank of the Naini Lake in Nainital.

title: Naina Devi Mandir
review: The temple is situated adjoining the lake. It a beautiful temple and one feels so calm inside the premises. The decoration was done really nicely. Durga Puja celebrations were going on while we visited. There was a cultural program also going on near the temple in the parking area

title: Beautiful Temple
review: We visited the temple during Durga Puja Time. It was decorated beautifully. Saw the evening Arti. temple is beautiful and also has a great view of the lake.One must definitely visit the temple while visiting nainital.There are many other Deities idols in the temple.

title: Goddess Naina the name behind the Naini Lake
review: This is a Hindu temple located on the bank of the lake. It has many dieties and Goddess Naina is the main. The place is maintained neat and clean. There is a market adjacent to temple.

title: Beautiful temple.
review: very famous temple. It is very well maintained. It remains little crowded but still one feels very peaceful after visiting the temple.

title: Very nice place
review: it's actually very small place but very peaceful. Unlike other temples across India, you will not find priests or other staff running around or crowd.

title: Nainadevi Temple
review: Beautiful situated at the end of the lake...devoted to Nsina Devi having beautiful view of Naini lake

title: Amazing Place nainital!
review: A view from Naina Devi temple in night is mind blowing. I was there duirng sunset and through night for some time. It was such a beautiful experience.

title: Very Nice temple
review: It's adjoining the lake & a clean beautiful temple . The approach roads were really bad from the lake side (we went just during rains ) but once inside it's very good. No long queues .

title: god is one
review: This temple is away from the city . So the taxis go there on no sharing basis . everyone who believes in god must go here and the one who enjoys the landscape views should definitaly visit this temple . There is a telescope which shows the himalayan range to closer view ..

title: Pious, Calm and Peaceful
review: Naina Devi temple is the heart of the city. When you enter the place you can feel the calmness and Peace around you. Beautiful temple and Breathtaking views around the temple. And the best part No beggars.

title: Goddess of Maa
review: Mara naina Devi temple located in the corner of Naina lake. Wonderful location and well managed place.

title: Big hindu temple on the lake
review: This temple gives the city its name: Nainital. There are 5 temples in the temple complex dedicated to different gods and godesses with Naina Devi temple in the centre. A truly spiritual place.

title: Lakeside temple
review: Temple is situated on the lake itself and is considered a shaktipeeth as Devi sati's eye is supposed to be fallen here. The feeling here is divine and Temple also provides with good veiws of the lake.

title: Temple
review: You don’t review temple, it’s a what a temple should be. What makes it interesting is the fact that it is located on the Naini lake itself.

title: Holy Place
review: A very calm temple, neat and clean and located at the most pretty point over seeing the nainital lake.If you go in the evening then better as you enjoy the beautiful lighting in the temple and capture great pictures of the lake and mountains before sunset. The temple is very clean and organised and there are no touts to cheat.

title: A siddh shakti peeth
review: It is one of the 52 shakti peeths of goddess Durga. It takes approximately 3 hours to visit the temple.

title: Where Nainital gets its name.
review: When Sati died and Shiv was doing the "Tandav" carrying the body of Sati one eye of Sati fell here and the other in what is now Himanchal Pradesh.

title: Well maintained
review: The temple has peaceful vibes due to the amazing lakeside. This temple is very neatly maintained. The main deity of the temple is Naina devi who sits along with Lakshmi and Saraswati.  The complex also houses one interesting hall dedicated to Dashavatarams.

title: spritual
review: beautiful temple in the valley and near lake and spirituality always gr8. wen i was there it was less crowded so it was added advantage.. i cud do very gud darshan of maa naina devi

title: Divine place
review: This is the most famous temple in nainital dedicated to mata Naina Devi.... very peaceful and divine place amongst the hills ...

title: Jai Mata Di
review: If u are visiting Nainital, I would strongly recommend to visit Naina Devi Temple as it is situated on the bank of Lake and whoever, is visiting will definitely feel refreshed and relaxed after the Darshan.

title: Evening Time at Naina Devi
review: Evening Time at Naina Devi. Actually we can visit this place anytime of day. Very peace and next to lake and city center.

title: painted bright orange
review: this where the eyes of a goddess landed after vishnu destroyed her. hence the name. situated serenely on the banks of the lake

title: Must visit Temple! Put it on you bucket list.
review: Very religious, loving and with healthy atmosphere surrounded by nanital lake , Pristine clear and divine environment

title: Good temple
review: Nice temple.. clean and well maintained, situated at the end of the Nainital lake. There are many shops and eateries around the temple.

title: i din't go inside but lot of people have faith in them
review: it situated in one of the corner of nani lake. A small temple and i think very ancient one as well. I waited outside but my family visited it and they feel really good and happy about to visit this temple

title: Nice temple!
review: Its a small temple that is neat & clean and well-maintained. Legend has it that it is one of the Shaktipeeths. From the temple, you can view the Nainital lake as well. Go and pay your respects to Naina Devi.

title: Temple by the Lake
review: A nice temple overlooking the Nainital Lake. The Tibetian market is just outside of it. A must visit.

title: Sparkling Clean on a Busy Day
review: We visited the temple on a Friday when there was a very very large crowd. The temple precincts were kept remarkably clean in spite of the rush

title: A historical temple in Nainital
review: The temple is situated adjacent to Naini lake on flat ground  and is easily accessible by all. Although worshippers visit it for worship purpose, It is worth visiting by tourists also.It provides a serene view of lake. Entry    is free and best time to visit it either early morning or evenings. There is ample parking space near the temple.

title: Temple at the Lake side
review: A beautiful temple at the lake side. As it is very near to the central parking place of Nainital, after parking the car, it may the first place to see. Approach to the temple much cleaner than usual temple sites in India. Puja thalican be bought from the shops adjacent to the temple. One can offer the puja without any hindrance from the pandas.

title: Nice temple near lake
review: Beautiful temple near lake. Way to Temple goes from Tibetan market. Visiting this very old temple is a memorable experience.

title: Beautiful temple
review: A must visit of nainital, beautiful temple with a wonderful view of naina lake. Situated at mallital close to parking lot. One can easily park their vehicle in parking area to visit this temple. Well managed and clean. Surround by shopping areas, food joints and tibetan market.

title: Naina Devi Temple
review: The very historical temple of Naina Devi, located at just coast of Naina lake. Well maintained and provide great views of lake.

title: Local famous temple.
review: Temple is one of the attraction. It is situated on the lakeside. You will find good shopping area with food option opposite temple.

title: Blessings
review: Goddess temple along with a big statue of Hanuman ji also. Both at its best! Wonderful visit and worth cherishing and to be remembered

title: Peacefull
review: A temple located next to lake and Tibetian market. The soothing lake and hill views leaves the place peaceful and soothing. It is an old temple built in 1800s and popular among residents of uttarakhand.

title: TEMPLE OF HINDUS
review: This temple is near to the naini lake ,near tibbet market,nainital names derives from the naina devi itself

title: Nice temple next to the lake
review: We offer our prayers here every time we visit Nainital. This has a cluster of temples and offering puja here does not take time.

title: Goddess Naina devi & Hanumanji Temple.
review: The temple is located on the bank of Naini lake, near Tibetan market...Market is good but hotels are very expensive & quality is not that much good.Would suggest to have something at mall road instead of tibetan market.

title: Nice Temple at naini lake
review: It was quite peaceful and nice at the bank of Naini Lake.  One can have beautiful view of naini lake from the temple.

title: Beautiful temple on the edges of Nainital Lake
review: The Naina Devi Temple stands as a beautiful temple on the edges of the Naini Lake. The town, the lake, and the temple borrow its name Naina (eyes) Devi temple. It is believed when Lord Shiva was carrying the corpse of Sati, her eyes fell to the ground where the temple currently stands.

title: Must visit place
review: The view of the lake from this temple is very very good.

title: Peaceful and Spiritual Moment
review: I visited Naina Devi Temple in Nainital. Though I am not a very religious person, the place filled me with peace and calm.

title: Must spend evening around this temple
review: Temple is at corner of Naini Lake. I suggest walking through Thandi Sadak (Cold Road) and arrives this temple. Take blessing of God and enjoy beautiful view from temple then do shopping in Tibetan market or watch Cricket match in Cricket ground then return walk through mall road or take Cycle rixa from mall road.

title: Goddess blesses you
review: The temple of Goddess Naina Devi is one of the oldest temples and people come from far to seek the Goddess's blessings. There are other temples too in the same compound. The big bell is really beautiful.

title: Location and Cleanliness is the best part of Temple
review: Temple location is one of the best part. It is clean and well maintained. One can also go to the local Tibetian market.

title: Nice temple at Nainilake
review: This is very old temple and nicely maintained surrounding area.

title: Historic Temple
review: Naina Devi temple is in itself was a great experience. Its situated next to the lake. So its very nice and clean. the view is awesome when u are boating and also when you are inside the temple. Everyone who visits lake for boating, should visit the temple atleast once.

title: Naina Devi Temple
review: One of the Beautiful Temple of Naina Mata. On the edge of Nainital Lake. You will feel the Lushy Air of lake and It is feel of Winter in the Month of May and June. So pleasant weather  in all around.

title: Eyes of Sati Devi at Nainital
review: The Naina Devi Temple is on the edge of Nainital Lake. Five minutes walk from the Bus stand through Mall road takes you to the 15th century built  temple in memory of the eyes of Sati Devi the wife of Lord Siva rebuilt last in 1883.Nanda Ashtami is the grand festival of the temple which is the main attraction of Nainital Lake.

title: Good location
review: Good location, management, cleanliness. We went there by boating. Surrounding it is shopper's paradise, the Mall road, Tibetan refugee market, etc. Naina lake in the vicinity provides for many activities like boating.

title: Optimum mix-Apt place for religious nature lovers-Visit even if you are non-religious.
review: Excellent atmosphere with fresh breeze on shores of Naini lake and aroma of incense sticks, Hawan and flowers with sound of temple bells ringing. Kids may be interested in watching colorful fishes in the lake from near the temple side grills. All in all excellent time spending place for  30 minutes to an hour.

title: Visit for divine blessings.
review: This temple is situated on one end of mall road near Tibetan Market at Lake. Very popular among locals and visitors. Name of lake and city is based on Naina Devi's name. Beautiful and peaceful.

title: Beautiful temple by the Lake!
review: Highly recommended for a visit. The location is fantastic with a great view of the lake. There’s a quaint street market right outside with some good eateries. One can easily spend 2-3 hrs in this area.

title: Religious and beautiful
review: Accessible from mallital bus stand

title: Peaceful
review: Beautiful temple I feel very positive and I really enjoyed nainital lake view and here hanuman temple and siva temple also

title: Feel at peace
review: The temple is adjacent to the Naini lake and near the flats in Nainital.A typical evening when there is no rush in Nainital and the sun has gown down the prayers being offered and the Bella ringing in the background make you feel in heaven.The place has a very soothing effect in evening of there is no rush and the prayers can be heard all along the Mall road. A must visit place if you are visiting nainital

title: Blessings with a Naini Lake View
review: One of the famous spot and temple in the Nainital. Tourists visiting Nanital visit this temple too for a Naina devi blessings. Temple is just located near to the tibetian market and is easily accessible.

title: Sprituality, Lake View, Serenity
review: One can enjoy close view of lake apart from spirituality and serenity of the temple. My daughter enjoyed watching fishes on the lake bank while in the temple

title: Holy Place !!!
review: While being at Nainital got an opportunity to visit Naina Devi Temple, quite famous and located at next to Naini Lake and Tibetan Market

title: Good temple
review: Such a great temple of maa naina devi, we visited in the month of April 2018.This temple is located inside the Tibetan market.

title: Temple by Naini Lake
review: Naina Devi temple is located by the Nainital Lake. It is walking distance from bus stand. You can also take rickshaw from rickshaw stand near the bus stand for rupees 20 to go to the temple.

title: Colourful temple in bazaar
review: The Naina Devi temple is a garish temple in the middle of the pseudo Tibetan market in Mallital.  The temple bells and chants can be heard all through the market and across the lake.  The stalls nearby sell tawdry tinsel cloth for offerings.  Cripples and beggars abound, hoping for some largess from the temple goers - but they are disappointed.  The largess only extends for the temple goers themselves.  Charity for the "there but for the grace of God" concept is sadly lacking as it is throughout the Indian religions and culture.

title: Temple CL added with  Bells
review: Ancient temple, lot of bell bunches is a difference. The background of goddess mentioned on board sets the frame. A good place

title: The birth place of Naini-tal
review: According to mythology, Naini lake was born of the eye of Goddess Sati that fell from the sky. This temple marks the verity of the history. Abode for Goddess Naini Devi, a colorful temple. Even though you are an atheist, this place will treat your eyes with a picturesque view of the lake with the colorful boats sailing in it. You can take a boat ride from Tallital to the temple and enjoy the lake as well as temple. Visit in late evening for a better experience.

title: Soulful experience!!
review: Extremely beautiful Goddess Naina Devi we were there with our family.In this temple you can also worship the big idol of Shri Hanuman. Very soulful experience

title: Must Visit .
review: Situated at one end of the lake. very near to Central Parking.

title: Excellent place to visit
review: Excellent view and ease of access to Mall Road, Naini Lake and other locations. Its center of the town and it has reach towards multiple places ( lake / food courts / shopping etc. )

title: Peaceful
review: A peaceful place with nice view of ninital lake . Ambience is also very good and there is a market near to the temple .

title: Naina Devi Shakti Peeth
review: Ancient temple of Goddess Naina Devi in Nainital. It's a Hindu worship place and one of the 51 Shakti Peethas of Maa Sati. Please don't take it as a picnic spot and follow the tradition and respect the rituals.

title: Holy Chants...
review: Wow..!!!! What an evening. Must visit place. You can have shopping in the local market nearby. Amazing experience.

title: Hindu Godess Temple
review: Nainital is highly focused for Naina devi temple daily hundreds of hindu devotees comes to worship this temple, rather than one can find other God like lord Shiva etc.temple is very neat and clean,free shoes kept here.

title: Pristine n peace of mind
review: We visited in last week of feb 18. Beautiful by location , maintainance and serenity. Less crowded no one will force or approach for puja. Nice to be here

title: Nice temple by the lake...
review: Temple by the lake... While it is for Goddess Naina Devi, it also has religious activities for Hanuman and Shiva. Note that, as in other temples in India, you have to take shoes off... When it is 10C outside... it may not be much fun...

title: Divine surroundings
review: Serene atmosphere. For Hindu spiritual people only with faith. Great divine Hanumanji in front of main door. Dayamai, karunamai Maa and other deities

title: Naina Devi Temple
review: Naina Devi Temple near Mallital is a well known Shakti Peeths of hindu religion. Goddess in this holy temple is represented by her two eyes. Tourists from far away come to this place to take her blessings. It is situated at around 2.5 kms from Tallital. There is a huge peepal tree at the center of the temple surrounded by thousands and thousands of metal bells that devotees have tied to the posts for religious reasons. The main deity is bordered by two lion statues. The temple is regarded as one of the 51 Shakti Peeths where the eyes of the Sati deity has fallen when Lord Shiva was carrying her on his shoulders.

title: Completes the visit to nainital
review: Located in mallital, one should come here and take the blessings of goddess naina devi when in nainital. It is open till late evening hours and is a popular shaktipeeth. Small market selling winter clothes, candle items etc is available just outside the temple premise. Boating facility and movie theatre is also there near the temple.

title: blessing of almight
review: one of the main attraction to seek blessing and also tibietian market around temple market u get good true copy stuffs...

title: A place for inner peace
review: Located adjacent to the Naini Lake ,the Naina Devi Temple is a place for some peace in the over crowded Nainital. The temple is just 2 minutes walk from Mall Road. You have to cross the old famous Tibetan market to reach the temple gate. The main temple and the surroundings are well maintained and are very clean and clear.The Devi darshan was smooth for us.

title: A peaceful abode of Goddess Naina Devi
review: Naina devi temple is locatd at one end of Nainital lake. Very peaceful temple. It is considered to be one of the Shakti peeths where eye of Sati was dropped. Good view of lake from inside. Entrance is from the Bhotia market. There is a walking path within the Bhotia market to go to Pashan Devi temple.

title: Jai Maa Naina Devi
review: Old beautiful temple, on the bank of Nanital lake, cool wind directly from the lake, don't forgot to pray Maa Naina Devi

title: Jai Naina Mata
review: This temple situated near Mallital and it is one of the main  attraction of Nainital.Myself and my family pray to Naina ma which is believe local almighty god.

title: Little commercialized but you will love it.
review: The temple is located at the end of famous 'Nainital Lake'. The hill station received its name Nainital from Goddess Naini Devi.

title: Divine temple!!!
review: We went to the Goddess Nana Devi temple in the morning. Had nice Sarah's of goddess and divine temple.

title: Naina Devi Temple is great
review: This temple is very famous in nainital also it is located in heart of nainital ( take a left turn from mall road towards capitol cinema and walk about 300 metres).

title: A well known Temple!
review: This Temple is located near Nainithal lake and you can reach here through. Located near the lake the Temple location is overwhelming. You have a huge statue of Lord Hanuman at the entrance. You will also find a lot of fishes near the Temple. This Temple is a must visit in Nainithal.

title: A good small temple
review: A beautiful small temple on the side of Nainital lake. This temple is neat and clean. A huge paid car park is at the front of the temple. Same two or there small shops also there in front of the temple.

title: Very nice location !!
review: A must visit place in Nanital, very peaceful and nice temple. Arrangements are also good and lake view gives a added advantage.

title: Another must visit of Nainital
review: Adjacent to the lake and near the Tibetan market. clean, well maintained with history and a nice view of the lake. Don't miss it.

title: If you are in nainital so must visit this attraction
review: Its good temple in Nainital , if you are near then you can go there have a grace from God Naina Devi.

title: One of 64 Shaktipeeths of Hinduism
review: One of 64 Shaktipeeths and is a very holy place of Hindu religion. As per mythology Goddess Sati's eyes fell here and hence the name. The view of lake was great. We walked from our hotel to the temple along the boulevard.

title: Place of Hindu pilgrimage
review: This is place where as per legend Maa Sati's eyes has fallen. That's why called Naina Devi and this city is called Nainital. Very spiritual and soothing place where one can connect with Goddess Naina.

title: Excellent Temple build on the lake
review: Lovely temple build at the end of the lake. Awesome view of the lake and very big. One must visit on the trip to Nainital.

title: Great experience to visit to this temple
review: It was a great experience to visit and worshipping Mata Naina Devi Temple. Clean and nice temple with the view of the lake.

title: divine place
review: visited this temple in our recent visit to nainital, the place is divine and beautiful. gives you lots of peace.

title: Temple near the lake. Bajranbali temple here and naini devi temple here. Best place. Open till 8pm.
review: Naini devi temple here. Best place. Open till 8pm.Temple near the lake. Bajranbali temple here. Go and enjoy the winter.

title: Temple on the banks of Nainital lake
review: Goddess Nainadevi temple is located on the banks of the great Nainital lake in the heart of Nainital town. Its about 3 kms from the bus stand and you can walk down or take a cycle rickshaw. The temple has a tall idol of Lord Hanuman welcoming you at the entrance. There are 2 shrines for the Goddess Nainadevi and Lord Shiva. The temple is painted in bright orange and looks attractive with the colourful syrroundings. From the temple you can get a nice view of the Nainital lake with the hills in the background. There are lot of shops near to the temple selling many trinklets for the curious tourists. There is a playground opposite the temple and a mosque on the other side. The view of the children playing in the open ground with the mosque  in the background is a wonderful memory. We can spend about 30 to 40 mins at this temple and surroundings.

title: Divine Visit in Mallital
review: Definitely a heavenly experience, especially view of Shiv temple with Naini lake in background. This temple is on the banks of Naini lake & nature view.

title: Holy place... can find best view of Lake
review: It is a small temple with great view of Nainital. If you want to sit after doing shopping in Tibetan  market this is a best place to sit and take photos. You can find best valley and lake view from there

title: Jai mata
review: Small temple based on naini lake .aarti time is amazing .nice clean with all prasad and various things available at entrance on reasonable rates

title: Jai Ho !!
review: Beautiful temple complex just next to the lake ! The main temple is the Naina Devi temple dedicated to the deity after whom the lake and the town are named !! Neat and clean, try and visit and take the blessings !!  Also get to see the school of fish in the lake along the retaining wall of the temple !!

title: Never miss to visit this temple
review: Never miss to visit this temple.  We went in the morning and it was amazing. Location of the temple is very good. We can get a good view of the Ninital lake too.

title: Beautiful Temple
review: The temple is situated on the bank of the Naini lake. The temple is very clean. Also, the time we visited, the weather was very charming.

title: Serene place for peaceful moments
review: We visited the temple on the day of Deepavali, when the town was bereft of the regular flow of tourists. The temple itself is believed to be an ancient one, located at the northern end of the lake viz. Mallital. In the proximity of this temple, there is a gurudwara as well as a huge beautiful mosque.

title: Holy Shrine
review: I went to Goddess Naina Devi Temple. Naina Devi Temple is a holy shrine that is dedicated to Shri Naina Devi, one of the forms of Goddess Shakti. Located on the top of a hill in Bilaspur district of Himachal Pradesh, Naina Devi Mandir is one amongst the fifty one Shakti Peeths. It is great place to go.

title: Very Spiritual Temple
review: This temple is very spiritual and very old temple over here. It is historical place and must visit place for all the travellers.

title: Must visit
review: Very peaceful place, if you have any wishes plz come here . Maa will full fill your all wishes.  Visit in day and night time you will see beautiful view from temple.

title: Must visit temple
review: if you visit Nainital then this is the most recommend temple to visit. It is really very spiritual place.

title: Goddess Naina Devi Temple
review: It is located on the banks of the Naini lake just at the start of the mall road. A nice temple to visit. On the outside you have plenty of small eateries and a Tibetan market for local shopping.

title: Fun playing with fishes
review: It was peaceful

title: Naina Devi Temple ,NAINITAL
review: Nice place to peace lover and Religious people must visit place if you are in nainital I am sure you will get good positivity in yourself

title: Nice place
review: It is very near to the car parking and boating point. Temple is nice and you can spent good time here.

title: The temple by the lake !
review: This temple of the Goddess is a treat to the eyes and soul . Located on the shore of the Naini lake and having great view of the lake in the

title: Beautiful
review: Beautiful Temple just attached to lake in mallital. Very good to visit in morning and evening prayers.

title: temple by the lake side
review: temple gave the name to the lake as naini lake and the place name nainital. a must visit place. another attraction is roadside shopping near to the temple

title: Located Near Nainital Lake
review: Went to this temple on 10th September 2017 in evening time. This temple is located near to Nainital lake. In the temple premises there are also statues of Lord Hanuman, Lord Ganesha. There is a Shiv Ling present near lake side.

title: Ma Naina Devi Nainital
review: this is the holy place temple near Naini lake.

title: Very close to the Lake
review: Conveniently located next to the main entry of the Lake, lot of shopping options on either side of the passage leading to the temple

title: peaceful
review: we visited the temple during navratra and there was no rush. The temple complex is neat and quiet on the banks of naini lake

title: Temple
review: Nice old temple, very well maintained neat and clean.  Visit to temple is a must as its located across Naini Lake.  Walking around Lake is a pleasure which covers Naina Devi and other temples.

title: Short vacation
review: It is very near from mall road. Temple of mama naina. Must visit place. Near to temple tibbatian market is also there.

title: Serene
review: Goddess Naina devi ji is most worshiped holy temple in nainital.. Maintained worship place with must see recommendation

title: A FAMOUS GODDESS OF MALLITAL , NAINITAL.
review: This is a very famous for GODDESS Naina Devi. The temple attract people. This is situated on hill top of Mallital in Nainital. Uttra Khand.

title: Nice
review: Its near to mall road, temple of naina devi, as per my view you must visit, bit crowdy but nice temple

title: beautiful temple on lake
review: the nanda devi temple is very famous among local... this is a beautiful temple on lake ... it always refresses you with cold breeze from lake ...

title: A quaint temple by the lake
review: Though it can get very crowded with tourists and newlyweds seeking Goddess Naina's belssings, it is still a temple worth visiting. The fact that there are many photo worthy spots near the temple makes it even more interesting. There are little shops that sell prasad and chunnis right outside the temple, in case you wish to make an offering.

title: Jai mata ki
review: nainital journey is incomplete without visiting naina devi temple..we visited when mela was going on and just loved the atmosphere..why not be religious and make your journey fully complete...

title: Naina Devi Temple
review: Reached the temple at evening aarti time, prasad can be purchased from outside temple, it has good amount of space hence its not overly crowded. the view at night of the lake from temple is something not to miss at any cost.

title: PEACE WORSHIP BEAUTY
review: When you see the entrance you think that mandir is too small but once you enter mandir premises is so large and after worship of devi ji. This place have osam view of naini lake. Aisa view apko mandir ke ander aake hi dekhna nasib ho sakta hai

title: Blessings of goddess Naina devi
review: Awesome place for worship. Here you can feel the power of God. Here Local people said that your wish will be completed sure. If you are going to Nainital then you should go the temple of devi.

title: NAINITAL
review: GREAT TEMPLE, And the best moment when there is aarti

title: centrally located well maintained
review: must visit in Nainital ,centrally located neat Tibet market, well maintained rush during pooja days . The town named in name of Naina Devi the temple goddess

title: Nice temple near nanital lake
review: 1. It's near on of the parking spot and mosque/gurdwara.

title: Enchanting experience!
review: We visited in the evening. The whole temple was glittering in its all glory. It is peaceful with so much crowd too. The night view of the whole city with shining lights and their reflection in the lake waters, from the bank of the lake in temple, is worth watching!

title: Naina Devi Temple Nainital
review: Just adjacent to Naini lake must visit this temple. There are also so many small temples in side the main temple premises. The aarti timings are early 7 am and in the evening 7 pm.

title: Temple situated in location pleasant view
review: In may 2017 last week i went to Kathkodam from haridwar by train. and from there reached nainital busstand. After got down from the bus in the morning I felt happy with joy.Seen the lake view. and walked around the lake.After taking bath went to Nainadevei temple which is situated near local market. I spent  nearly 2 hours there due to drizziling rain.I have to stay only one night there after visiting laking around by walk. I will go again to see almora and kausani (switzerland of india). I planed to visit in short after monsoon over.

title: Beautiful temple
review: A beautiful temple next to the lake. Calm and quiet and one should go in the morning. Just see the goddess and forget everything. You can see many fishes in the lake too.

title: Jai Mata Di. Very very good place with awesome view.
review: Naina Devi temple is located almost over the lake in nainital. View from varandah is awesome in might as you see lights on the mountain like stars and view of lake is awesome too in night.

title: The goddess of lake
review: According to a legend the temple of NAINA DEVI is situated at the place where eyes of goddess sati fell . This is a small but very neat and clean temple. Along with the main deitiy there are other gods like Lord shiva, Lord hanuman and santoshi Mata. You  can visit this temple by road or by boating. The road leading to temple is dotted with small shops selling puja items. During sep-Oct there is a fair of nanda devi where the kuldevi of king of kumaon NANDA DEVI is worshipped with her sister SUNANDA DEVI

title: Naina Devi temple tourist attraction
review: This is one of the most important attractions in Nainital. There is nothing negative about the site. Just beware the floor outside the temple can be very hot during midday.

title: Naina Devi a goddess well known as " Naina dev"
review: Its just in the bank of Naini lake and Naini lake was named after Naina Devi. each year lots of customers & devotes visit this temple with high faith and trust on this goddess.

title: Peaceful and divine
review: The temple is at one end of the Mall road. One can take a boat ride to reach it or even go via mall road.The mall road is full of hustle and bustle and there are quite shops even on foot path outside the temple. But after all this chaos the moment you enter the temple , you feel peace. One can spend some time in the temple premises gazing at the lake. The ambience is something to experience , especially early morning or late evening.

title: A truly divine place in a city nestled in the hills..
review: Awesome place and lovely views being just beside the lake. You will get to see local culture there. Ask the punditji and they will tell u all about the temple. If possible try to visit early in the morning both for the views and also if u are interested to know the history in detail.

title: Nice location temple
review: Nothing much to say.. its a temple, nice views and good street market nearby. Surrounded by gurudwara, masjid and church

title: Try to be here during dusk
review: Try to walk by Nainital lake Mall road anti-clock-wise during dusk. Visit the temple of Naina Devi, may be you will be reach there during evening worship ("aarti"). You can also give "puja" during that time. The evening worship periodic bell creates a very good ambience. But do not miss the lake (Naini) from there. It is probably the best place to see and capture the lake at evening time. Can take tripod to capture long exposure snaps. Nearby attractions: a movie hall and a shop for wax souvenir(do not miss this one).

title: Naina Devi temple
review: This temple is located on  one end of the Lake,  we got down near the temple. after boating in the lake, Temple is beautiful and the place is kept neat and clean, Nice place and peaceful environment.

title: Beautiful Temple at the City Centre
review: This beautiful temple is located on bank of the Lake, and with a spectacular view. The temple is a clean place with Bhotia Market outside.

title: Great Location
review: It's quite a famous attraction near Mall Road.

title: Serene And peaceful
review: A beautiful temple on the bank of the Nainital lake. Must visit place in Nainital. The temple is dedicated to Naini Devi

title: Mr.akshay
review: Best temple with many gods temple inside ...good tibetian shopping market nearby..also best atmosphere as lake nearby

title: Nice temple right next to Naini Lake
review: Naina Devi temple is located right next to the Naini Lake and is a must see for the religious minded. Offers nice views of the lake and is maintained very clean.

title: Naina Devi temple
review: well known tourist place in Nainital. Small and beautiful temple on lake side. you can enjoy boating or walk to Tibetan market with temple visit.

title: Decently maintained temple
review: Good temple for visit. Can spend 1-2 hours. Just next to the lake. Post temple visit, you can spend sometime at the Tibetian marketing.

title: Quick to cover !!
review: Well India has lot of temples . What makes it special is its lake side . You can have beautiful lake view from here. Rest is common like the shops around it ,the resting places .

title: A nice view temple!
review: A nice temple near one of the end of Nainital lake. Temple has 3 major Hindu gods. Though, temple usually remain quite crowded. A sacred picturesque point. Temple can easily be reached by walking from bus station along Mall road at one of its end.

title: One of the Shaktipeeths
review: It is said that eyes of maa Gauri fell here when angry Shivji was carrying here body on his shoulders.

title: Holy and nice place
review: This is a temple of goddess naina devi.this is a very nice place very beautiful it is small and beautiful place there also has a huge murti of God Hanuman ji one who belive in god must visit this place around and nearly has a very beautiful market and naini lake.

title: Beautiful location on the bank of Nainital
review: Visit  during evening Aarti, you will feel the divine blessing. Situated in the banks of Nainital you also get a very good view of Tal .

title: beautiful temple on banks of lake
review: we had a bath early morning and visited this temple. the scenic beauty of the lake from the temple premises is breath taking

title: Good temple
review: It is a good temple nicely maintained. Worth visiting and near to Nainital lake and mall road and hence no extra efforts to visit to the temple

title: Divine
review: A place for Hindu worship. It was not crowded when we went but I am not sure if it is like that all the time. Lovely views from the temple. Peaceful.

title: Jai mata di
review: A must place to visit. Very energetic full of spiritual soul.

title: Peaceful
review: So beautiful temple it is.i visited here in may with my family.it is located on the bank of naini lake.outside of temple there is beautiful bhutiya market from there you can buy lot of beautiful candles

title: Holy temple in the lake city of Nainital
review: This is an ancient temple in Nainital, it is Naina Devi Temple and I think Nainital is the name derived from the name of the Goddess. One can visit this temple while in Nainital and seek the blessings of the Goddess.

title: Naini devi temple
review: What a beauty of lake in night?? Whole city is sparking with nainilake. It is opposite side of the mall road so it not very crowdy, you can spent some very good time with your ownself

title: by the lake side...
review: temple located by the lake side...beautiful temple... nature at it's best...clean and neatly maintained....

title: Godess NainaDevi
review: This Devi temple is on naini lake and tibetian mkt. close by. from temple you have nice view of naini lake.

title: A must visit place
review: I visited with my family. The temple is just next to Naina Lake, market and is well built. Its a must visit

title: Near lake
review: Named after the goddess Naina Devi this place is peaceful and doesn't require a review. As it's a place for worship

title: Holy place
review: you can start your nanital trip by visiting this holy place located very close to lake and mall road

title: Visited this so many times
review: I've visited Nainital for like 20 times now cuz it's my mothers birth place . So I've visited this temple and seen it a lot of times . Love the fact that it's by the late . Serene and beautiful worth a visit . Please visit !!!!

title: At banks of naini lake
review: It's soothing at banks of naini lake... The Tibetian market near us expensive but better than mall road for shopping...

title: holy temple beside Naini lake
review: Small nad beautiful temple. Very quiet and serene. Located at a very convenient place right across the Naini lake. Peaceful and quite well maintained.

title: Naina devi temple
review: A must visit place for all the visitors to nainital . The local market is also surrounded before the temple . You can eigber go up by walking or even through boating in the naini lake .

title: Place of worship.
review: Goddess Naina Devi Temple is located on the bank of Nainital lake. Spirituality in the Very pleasant and cool weather is real bliss.

title: Beautiful temple
review: The Naina Devi temple is located on the banks of Naini lake. The temple is very beautiful and does provide a very good view of the lake @ night. The Tibetian market is just outside the temple.

title: Must Visit Place in Nanital
review: Naina devi temple is surrounded by tibetan and other local market and located at the banks of beautiful nani lake. You can spend quite some time in the temple enjoying the lake view.

title: Enjoyed aarti on Poonam
review: We visited this temple during evening time and it was aarti time.. We took this opportunity to be remain there till aarti ends. It was full moon night. we liked so much.

title: Adobe of Calmness
review: A very sacred religious place for Hindus. One of the Saktipeth of Godess Durga. The Full temple complex is extremely well maintained by the trustees. There is no hustle & Bustle of Pandas. One can offer his offering at his own time. The structure of main mandir is well kept.

title: Temple
review: Renowned Temple of Nainital..

title: Spiritual bliss
review: inspiring temple...lake view..has a market very close by..you can sit quiet and pray..feel the bhakti and have good time

title: Quiet place on banks of the lake
review: You get a beautiful view of the houses on the hill when you go at night. Night views of city from here are excellent.

title: Divine place for Hindu and other religions
review: One of the major Shaktipeeth. One must visit for inner peace and getting blessing of goddess. One can spend some time in the temple and enjoy the scenic beauty of adjoining places.

title: excellent. must visit
review: The temple is exactly near NAINI LAKE. It is excellent to visit this temple as Nainital got its name from this temple's important only.its a spiritual place with awesome view of naini lake.

title: Holy place near lake
review: It is located near the lake. This is said to be sacred temple of Goddess Parvati. Very neatly maintained.  Has a nice prayer hall and always crowded with devotees

title: located at the prime area a must to visit
review: beautiful small temple with nice location and some shopping area adjacent to it. located at walking distance from mall road.

title: Excellent
review: It is excellent to visit this temple as Nainital got its name from this temple's important only. Here it is believed that Maa Durga's eyes (naina) were thrown at this place.  So it is highly respected and religious values for hindus.

title: The Old and Renowned Temple in Utterakhand
review: I was very much fortunate to visit Nainital a few days back and visited this place.It is a cool and calm place just at the end of Naini lake. It is a huge temple and a lot of people visit this place all the times. The entry is free and one can easily see the temple as there is not much crowd these days (except Navratri).

title: clean and serene temple
review: very well kept place right on the edge of the lake mesmerising veiw and amazing feeling at the temple,

title: Serene temple on the banks of Naini lake
review: Quaint, small temple, but very beautiful one. On Mall road.Convenient location, and has the Tibetan market right outside of it!

title: Famous Naina Devi Temple in Nainital
review: Located on the edge of Naini Lake, it is the famous temple of Nainital with a Gurudwara, Church and Masjid in the close vicinity. Just outside is the Tibetian market to shop some real cheap stuff.

title: Beautiful location
review: This temple is at a very beautiful location as its right in the corner of the naini jheel and the view from here is amazing.

title: A serene spiritual place
review: This is a Shaktipeetha on the bank of the Nainital Lake and the entrance is from the corner of the flat ground. The place with a nice view of the lake is quiet and not very crowded . The spiritually minded people will feel peace of mind if he/she spends a few moments here. One can offer Puja or can simply visit and offer Pranama.

title: Good place
review: It is near by the Nainital lake. It is small temple of Godess Sati, It has in the front Hanuman, inside Naina Devi is a small beautiful idol. See the eye marking it will be like the Nainital lake resemblance. You can spent about half and hour max. Peaceful location, near market place. You can purchase if you want in the market place.

title: Must visit
review: Peaceful divine atmosphere. Clean, beautiful location, hall and open place to sit. Visited in the evening during Aarti - great experience

title: Peaceful and beautiful
review: Attend the evening Arti here under the cool breeze and beautiful mountains, you will feel so peaceful and good. The small market outside the temple and the Naina Lake next to it, gives an awesome view.

title: Tribute to Goddess Naini Devi
review: A clean and neat temple on the shore / corner of Naini lake. Really enjoyed darshan at peace, since there was no rush on 13 Apr 17.

title: Naina Devi
review: Few people know that this is one of the Shaktipeeths of Sati. This is where the left eye of Sati was dropped when Lord Shiva was carrying her dead body on his shoulder. The temple is very quiet and clean without any rush of heavy crowd. Very well maintained and serene place overlooking the Nainital.

title: Pristine
review: Extremely clean and spiritual.The history of Nainital is based on this temple and needless to say, it is divine too.

title: Religious place
review: Visit the temple in the early morning. To avoid the cacophony of tourism related activities later in the day. The picturesque lake makes for a perfect backdrop while u reach to the gods.. and make for a wonderful way to start the day

title: Offers a pictursque view
review: The temple is quite famous in Nainital. It is a small shrine flanked by the Naini Lake, the view from here is no doubt is spectacular. Good place for photography as well.

title: Nice temple
review: I visited this temple after boating at naini lake. This is a very nicely maintained temple. It was really a pleasant experience. One must visit. Situated besides naini lake.

title: Amszing
review: A must visit even if you don't believe  in God

title: Temple with nice view
review: The temple is situated in the midst of the city but the view at the back of the temple is really awesome. Temple is clean and serene

title: A beautiful temple
review: An important shrine for Hindus as this is the place, where the eyes of the goddess Parvati fell ..A serene and beautiful temple on the banks of the lake.

title: Temple of Goddess Naina Devi...
review: I cant rate it to either poor or excellent.... its a matter of devotion.... Goddess Nanda Devi is worshiped in Uttarakhand and personally I worship her too. This place is located a heart of city. Next to Naini lake and Tibeetean market.... a must visit place...

title: Serene and peaceful
review: This is a very old temple close to Bhutia Market.Temple premises  is very neat and clean.You can sit there for a while and admire the beauty of lake.

title: Small, quiet temple
review: This temple is right off Naini Lake and is dedicated to goddess Naina Devi. This is supposed to be the place where the eyes of Sati fell, as her body was carried by Lord Shiva across the skies. Hence, the deity here is worshipped by her two eyes (naina in hindi).

title: Must Visit
review: Located beside Naini lake, this temple is a must visit. Just by visiting temple you will cover Tibetan Market.

title: Must Visit
review: Temple at mall road and main bazar. You can visit the temple in evening time and can enjoy a great view of Naini Lake.

title: Naina Devi Temple
review: I have visited this place during my visit to nainital. I have stayed at Tallital so it was at the opposite side of lake. This place is clean and well maintained. Place is there for keeping shoes and washing hands. Shops are there for puja.

title: Loved it
review: This is a beautiful temple situated on the bank of lovely lake.  it is just awesome to be here and offer prayers.

title: holi temple of Naina Devi
review: The temple is very old and crowded in evenings . The aarti is very nice to watch. From the temple once can go to the lake and ropeway . There are several food stalls and market nearby , This is one hotspot to spend leisure time

title: Naina Devi Temple, side by Naini Lake, Must Go for worship
review: Situated just side by Naini Lake and Mall road. You can go for worship and having view of Naini lake from temple. sit and feel the peace.

title: Solace to soul
review: Removed shoes and got wooden Kharava to wear, enjoyed tak tak sound. It was Arti time. Direct in Mata ji's Charan. Very beautiful lake view from Mandir. Chilly breeze shook us head to toe.

title: Must Visit In Nainital
review: This temple is very famous in Nainital on the banks of naini lake. You can also do shopping in nearby Tibetan market. Going to temple after boating in lake is very peaceful.

title: Must visit
review: its a naina devi tample i can not tell much about because un fortunately i did not visit in the temple,but my father visited over there its near by china market and parking.

title: Must visit
review: Its in the city and next to Gurdwara (Sikh Temple). Its a historical temple so you must visit and also enjoy the food outside in the market.

title: A very good Shrine
review: Must visit this place to pay your respects to the Devi of Nainital. Situated just beside the lake. Has a very spiritual atmosphere, A small shrine of Lord Shiva Mahadev overlooking the lake  is bautiful

title: Divine place
review: If you are a religious person, the first thing to do in Nainital is to get darshan of divine Maa Naina devi. Its a beautiful temple located at pictuersque bank of Naini lake,Mallital. Photography in main  Mandir is strictly prohibited. But one can get beautiful pics in the corridor. One can feel the peace of mind & soul once u get the darshan. Neat, clean & tidy well maintained temple. No cheatng by temple preists.

title: Place to Worship
review: Situated along the lake, cleans your soul. has a spiritual atmosphere and must visit place while you are at Nainital

title: Religious place
review: Most famous temple of Nainital.

title: Picturesque location, beautiful temple
review: Regarded as one of the Shakti Peeths, Naina Devi temple offers a peaceful respite. Built right on the banks of the beautiful Naini lake and flanked by the Tibetan market, the temple offers a great opportunity to both worship and soak in a bit of history (the temple goes back to 15th century as per some sources, not confirmed though).

title: Clean nice well maintained temple in the bank of nainital lake.
review: Nice temple at the bank of nainital lake. Very nicely maintained, all cooperative staffs of temple and here the brahmins are also good.

title: Keeping it simple
review: Being a local boy i visited the temple after a long break..so it was a mixed emotion for me. The temple has been renovated and is now almost a tourist must. On the otherhand the charm of a small towns place of devotion seems to hav diminished. Maybe thats just me?

title: very popular local temple
review: This is different from the Shakti peeth Naina Devi that is in Himachal Pradesh. This temple is from where Nainital gets it name. Located right next to the lake, it is a small, somewhat old temple, frequented by the locals.

title: This is one of the shaktipeeth's. Worth a visit
review: This temple is located on the upper edge of the Naini Lake. It is the place where the eyes of Devi Sati fell. The temple is not very huge. It is worth a visit and seek the blessings of the sacred goddess.

title: Divine
review: We visited the temple after completing over boating as it is on the corner of the lake. One goes to the temple and asks a wish from the goddess and tie a chunri

title: Nice Temple
review: This is a wonderful temple. Though water in the lake has reduced considerably, the temple attracts all because of its vibrance.

title: Instead of being Famous still small and silent place
review: Yes, being famous temple of Nainital the temple is small and quite peace,

title: Naina Devi Temple
review: Situated on the banks of the lake and heart of nainital is this temple. A must for every visitor in the region.  It's easy to get and doesn't take much time to pay a visit here. Facilities to leave footwear inside is managed by the temple. One is not forced to make any offerings and neither the priests try to persuade to make any donations. it is right next to the Tibetan market and a handful of eateries.

title: Great view
review: Must visit site in Nainital. Not crowded, small temple. Has a breathtakingly beautiful view of the Naini lake. Situated at one of the corners of the lake and right next to the Tibetan marketplace.

title: Religious
review: Loved the temple it was simply religious having a faith in god and just loved the atmosphere of the temple must visit once in your lifetime

title: Naina Devi Temple
review: Must go place if in Naintal infact start your tour with blessings of Naina Devi. Temple is quit appealing. View of lake from temple premises is awesome. Photography allowed but not of Main temple

title: Nainital gets its name !
review: Nainital gets its name because of this goddess Nainadevi at the bank of Naini lake. The temple is painted in red well maintained. Visit once to seek the blessings.

title: Naini Mata the Goddess of Nainital
review: Local people more often call this temple Naini Mata temple. The name Naina Devi can confuse because there is another temple of her in Himachal Pradesh. The goddess blesses all visitors who visit her temple with a pure heart. You need not ask for anything from her because she already knows what you need most and is sure to help if you visit. Greet and seek the permission of Lord Hanuman who stands at the gate of temple guarding her. A book in English with the title "Naini Mata, Goddess of Nainital' is available at most online retailers of books including Amazon. It is a must read for all who love the Goddess.

title: The temple on the lake !
review: The famed temple, bang on the edge of the lake is dedicated to the goddess Naina Devi. The temple is small in area, it would take only 15- 20 minutes or so to do the darshan. The temple is between the lake and the foothills, so there's always a great breeze and you will feel good about being there. Best time to visit the temple is mid day, particularly in the cold days. The access is easy from Car Parking/ Flats or Mallital by foot. There's is provision for storing your foot ware/ shoes at the entrance to the temple.

title: Average place
review: There is a temple of Naina devi which is situated over the top of the mountain. Usually there is very huge crowd. So take care of your belonging  and don't try to capture any photos in the temple as camera and phones are strictly prohibited. There is also rope way to reach there for around 500 bucks per person.

title: One of the Shaktipith - Nainadevi Temple
review: On very first day, after boating we reached @ the  Main temple of Nainital. "chacha" - old boatman said that, its one of the shaktipith. Goddess Sati's eye created this lake hence its name is Nainital. Temple give you the spiritual strength.

title: Maa Naina Devi ki Jai
review: Hey All!

title: divine place in the backdrop of calm & serene naini lake
review: this temple is located very near to the Tibetan Bhotia market . one can offer prayers here and enjoy the calm & serene Naini lake away from the noisy bazaar.

title: good temple
review: you must visit this temple.net & clean in temple aria location on the lake very nice shopping aria is near hear..

title: Awesome
review: Near to Mall Road, Fixed price for Boating, Good View,

title: In the Lap of Spiritual Divinity
review: A temple located in perfect serene location by the lake. The revered shrine has rich religious values and devotees throng in large numbers. Sitting within the campus provides relaxing peace of mind and heart.

title: Very popular temple in nainital
review: Visit to Naina devi is a must while in nainital. The temple is located at the end of the mall road and has several local Restaurent to try authentic local food

title: Worship time
review: This temple is near about the nainital stadium.Temple is full off peace and neat and clean.From the temple you can get the beautiful view of lake, local shop are available,fixed price of boating.You will get fully peace and relaxed here.It is located at the end of lake, small temple but this temple is very old.

title: Beautiful temple
review: a beautiful temple located on the banks of the lake.. lovely view of the lake from the temple.. ....

title: Naina Devi temple
review: I have been a frequent traveler for the Nainital, the beauty of the Nainital, the Place is serene and you can have mountain and the lake combination at a same time

title: hope it bring goodluck
review: well, nothing exciting for me inside. Its totally your choice to visit or not. some one said me it will bring goodluck so i did.

title: NICE SERENE TEMPLE IN NAINITAL
review: Beautiful temple on the the banks of Naini Lake. Serene place to spend some useful time and offer prayers.

title: Naina Devi temple
review: Its a beautiful temple located one side of Naini lake and bhutia market.The atmosphere is divine, and the views are just awesome.Its walking distance from mall road.

title: Jai ho!
review: Jai ho naina devi ki ....mandir by lake side and there is also small hanuman ji mandir near naina devi mandir which is considered equally important...have faith and mata will do the rest

title: On one side of Naini Lake
review: The temple is near Tibetan market on one side of Nainital Lake. As the name suggests, it is dedicated to Goddess Naina Devi. People was taking photographs inside. I took a photograph here with full length of Nainital lake on the back side.

title: Naini temple
review: Do visit this temple if you are at nainital it is one of the oldest temple one should see hanuman temple too

title: A summit of gods in which Naina Devi stays right at the center.
review: Temple is right behind the nainital stadium and you have to walk for 10 to 20 mins from stadium through a small mall road to reach the temple. There are some 5 to 6 temples in total inside but the major attraction being the naini devi it is must visit place for every traveller. From the temple one can get good views of lake too. One can spend around 20 to 30 mins if you are not in a hurry just sit for an hour it makes your mind peaceful.

title: nice temple
review: small temple , nice atmosphere on the banks of the lake. still a bit quite inside.  just outside the tibetian market so very noisy

title: The Goddess of Nainital
review: A small temple which is also one of the 51 Shakti peetha. A religious place recommended for seeing in Nainital. It is believed that the eyes  of the goddess fell here.

title: Mata Naina Devi Ji
review: Beautiful Temple of Goddess Naina ji ,surrounded by nature,hills and corner of Naini lake.Every one should visit and have blessing from Goddess Naina devi ji.

title: Naini Temple
review: It is located at the end of lake. It is a simple temple but one of the oldest temple. Nearby the temple you will find tibetian market for woolen cloths and some candles show selling designer candles

title: Just at the shore of Naini Lake
review: Before we went for boating in the Lake, we visited Naina Devi temple. Passing thru the parking area and Tibetan market we entered into the temple. It really felt good inside the temple, it was pretty clean instead of such a major footfall. Kids were enjoying watching the fishes in the lake from the railings which are situated at the lake side of the temple.

title: A Pleasant, Cool Worship Place
review: It is at one end of the Mall rd, near BaraBazar entrance gate. Next to- is a Gurudwara and a Mosque.Outside of temple is Tibetan Mkt. On entrance is Hanuman Statue and left side is Nainadevi  The premises with marble flooring. and enough room for rituals to carry on.

title: good temple to visit
review: one can walk from hotel naina devi temple if hotel is located nearby and temple visit is must for families.

title: Jai mata ki
review: Beautiful temple besides lake nani. We offered our prayers and sat here for sometime to enjoy the view. Great Peace!!

title: Jai Mata Di..
review: The Naina Devi temple in whose name Nainital has been named is a beautiful temple at the beginning of the Mall Road. It's quiet and scenic surroundings makes for a good darshan. It was clean and not bustling with people and no long queues like other important temples. So definitely make sure to visit.

title: Hindu Temple
review: Must visit this temple if you are hindu,because there are many faith and true believes with this Naina Devi temple near the lake.

title: A must visit temple in Nainital
review: Situated on one side of the lake it a quiet and serene place where you can spent good time praying and meditation.

title: Peace full and bless full place in Nainital
review: I love this place. I visited this place with my family and i belive if u have any wish then Naina devi fullfill all ur wishes. View of lake from this place is breathtaking.

title: Eye of the goddess - Temple of Nainidevi
review: Wonderful temple reverberating with the aura of faith in the people visiting the temple. The temple is simple but its crowd-pulling power is magnificent, esp as it is right next to the pristine Nainital Lake.

title: nice
review: the location is just lake side. and peaceful location and can devote your time for spiritual experience.

title: must to visit
review: its a good place.near lake , view is very good...but again same things no system nothing...

title: Divine Experience at Naina Devi
review: Naina Devi is right beside the nainital lake. The first look is not impressive – one wonders what is special about the temple. True the temple is simple – the premises pristine. We went on Durgapuja and the only puja of nainital happens there. Overall a peaceful place .The temple associated with many legends and mythology is pristine white standing against the azure blue sky looked beautiful as we approached towards the temple. Before reaching the temple we passed through rows of colorful stalls, selling chunaris, flowers and sweets to offer to the Goddess. After offering Puja, it was time to enjoy the scenic view  of the lake and enjoy boating there. Recommended for your first day in nainital trip.

title: a temple with beautiful location
review: A must visit place when you are in Nainital. It is a temple of Devi Naina Mata. It is situated in the mall just beside the lake. You can walk through the Bhutia market in the mall road to go there. The lake looks awesome from the Mandir premises. As it is One of the Satipith it is a very sacred places for Hindus. The total temple complex is lightened beautifully in the evening.

title: nice deity
review: This place is one of the 51 Sati piths. Here the eye of Maa Sati was dropped. The temple is quiet and the Naini lake is too good. We had a nice morning walk here from our village. There is no rush in the temple. one can take his breakfast in the near by market.

title: Beautiful temple
review: This is a very famous temple. Located right at the nainital lake. Very close to this mandir is the tibetan market.

title: Must Visit Good Experience@ Nainital
review: Feeling of peace and bliss when you visit and pray at this Naina Devi temple. Must visit when you goto Nainital , located close to the lake near Mall Road. Nainital is named after Naina Devi

title: Jai Maa Naina Devi
review: Nainital hill-station derives its name from Deity Naina Devi and Naini Lake. It is situated at one end of the Naini Lake. This place is a must visit.

title: One of the best temple near lake
review: This is one of the best temple just attached to lake..the temple was clean. V went at evening time n it looked beautiful in lights

title: Best temple near lake
review: Temple of naina devi is best for the visitors, for there spirituality and beauty, we feel blessed at the temple, its worth fo visit Temple, when you visit to nainital. Simply nice to visit for all ages.

title: peaceful temple
review: The temple is near the lake and you can always find the tourists and local people around. It is peaceful and you will feel good after the blessings of naina mata .

title: Jai naina mata ki......
review: Its near nainital lake and main attraction all tourist came here at this temple, there are 4-5 temple of different gods inside. nothing special just a regular temple. Tibet market and main parking is nearest to the temple.

title: Blessing of the goddess
review: A short visit to the templ.... was good. The time i visited lucky enough that there was no rush in the temple. It has a huge parking space. Rs.100 for parking.

title: Nainadevi temple
review: This is the temple which give s name to the hill station. This is situated just adjacent to Nainital lake. Beauty of the location is is that all these attractions are within walkable distance.

title: Goddess Sati Temple
review: Situated alongside with the northern shore of the Nainital Lake,the temple is dedicated to goddess Sati and is counted among the 'Shakti Peethas' dedicated to her.The temple is full of brilliant architecture.Place is very refreshing.

title: Spiritual & scenic
review: A must visit for Nainital as you will be missing an important part of Nainital's culture. Quaint temple with a beautiful view of the lake...

title: Divine Blesings!!
review: A very popular temple with locals as well as tourists. Shakti Goddess is worshiped here. Morning tremendous rush . Very peaceful place o visit

title: Shaktipeeth must visit
review: Place where left eye of Shakti fell.no chaos.clean.conviniently located.compared to other shakti peters like Kamakhya in Gauhati or Kali mandir kolkata where pandas are a pain here there are no pandas

title: Divine temple, evening aarti is awesome. Loved it
review: This is a very nice, neat and clean temple of goddess Naina Devi. You will feel that divine aura while you are here. Don't miss evening aarti as this is best time to visit the temple. you will love lighting at evening.

title: Situated at the bank of Nainital lake
review: Perfect location ... Tremendous positive energy with full of natural view... Don't miss the location ... Take boat from mall road and just get down near to Naini Devi temple... Have a dars ham and come and stand looking towards the lake... Great experience ... Try to visit during morning time...

title: Jay Ma Naina Devi
review: Experienced great peace of mind on visiting and worshiping at this holy shrine situated by the side of the Naini Lake

title: nice religious place
review: nice temple to visit, especially, the lake its named after this and must visit for all tourist and also the adjoining tibet market

title: Peaceful temple adjoining a beautiful lake
review: If you visit Nainital, I would highly recommend a trip to Naina Devi Temple. The temple overlooks the massive Nainital lake and is an absolute delight for your eyes. Unlike most North Indian temples, the main deity is made of black granite stone and there is a steady stream of visitors who keep thronging the place.

title: A beautiful temple by the side of Naini Lake
review: One of the main attractions of Nainital is Naina temple. Located on the bank of Naini Lake, this temple is beautiful and a must visit. The view of the lake and the reflections of the city lights in the lake in the night is spectacular.

title: A serene place
review: Blessed to have visited during Navratras. A must go if you are in nainital. Very cleanly and professionally maintained Goddess Abode. Walking distance from Mall Road. Has Naini Lake on one side and has Bhoatia/Local Market.

title: Excellent Temple
review: This is a temple one must visit every time one visits Nainital. The presiding goddess of Nainital, Nanda Devi or Naina Devi has a special atmosphere around her and in the temple. This temple is located near the main parking lot for Nainital, which one would have to anyway visit for parking. Also, the temple is near a mosque and a gurudwara, bringing in feelings of religious camaraderie. The fence facing the lake is also a spot one must visit while in the temple for seeing the fishes and also feeding them would display their wonderful acrobatic skills!

title: Its a Temple
review: Nice small colorful temple located at one corner of Naini lake. It's a peaceful place offering good views of the lake.

title: Cultural heritage...!!
review: We visited this temple on one fine evening, the temple was slightly crowded since it was an auspicious day, the temple promotes the rich cultural heritage of nainital, it is one of the must visit places in nainital, the local people were so friendly and humble, they assisted us and they even told some stories while we were standing in the queue.. overall we had a pleasant evening here along with the cultural experience...!!!

title: Temple near lake
review: The temple is famous with locals. It is a big Hindu temple where you can worship various Hindu Gods.

title: Shaktipeeth in Nainital
review: We visited this temple during Dussehra & so there was a buzz all around. It is a very serene place right next to the Naina Lake.

title: The Shaktipheeth
review: The Shaktipheeth of nainidevi is very close to nainital lake. The place is always full of visitors.The temple of naini devi is a must-visit for travellers.

title: Goddess Naina Devi
review: Nice temple near the Naini Lake. You have to buy prasad from the neaby shop and enter the temple. Nice view of lake from the temple

title: Good holy place..
review: This temple is well maintained. A must visit for travellers as per the tourist manual. Is located in city area. Easy approach.

title: Divine Feeling!
review: I travelled in 1st week of September and luckily there was some annual festival going on for Maa Nanda Sunanda Devi and i got a chance to attend evening Aarti which is really a divine feeling. One must visit this temple as it has a history attached to it.

title: Nanda Devi Temple
review: The Temple in very ancient Temple , , Located on Bank of Naini Lake , the Mall Road of Nainital ,ia slso nersby to the Temple
