review: One should always go to this temple if you are visiting Nainital for one obvious reason, the place is named after the goddess Naina Devi. Just be careful with the street sellers and pick pocketers. Do not leave your belongings anywhere even for a minute. I saw many people searching for there belongings in the temple and I was there only for an hour. So, you can imagine the type of pick-pocketers roaming around .

title: Beautufully located
review: Just around the corner of naini lake. Looked even more beautiful in rain. Peaceful and calm, spend time with yourself there.

title: beautiful and peace ful
review: must temple to visit in nanital its a religious place has its own importance for the local people and the visitors coming , love the place its quite peaceful

title: Visit this place in the evening time. Located at the end of the lake, has a very pleasant view.
review: Very quiet place and provide a good view to Naini lake. You can feel peace when you seated and listening bells of the temple in evening.

title: Beautiful temple
review: Located at the end of the lake, has a very pleasant view. You can go either by boat or by walking by the mall road. I will suggest you to go walking by mall road, stay in the temple for some time and return to you hotel by boat.

title: Nice
review: The temple overlooks Naini lake. You can reach there by road as well as boat. i proffered a boat ride. The temple is neat clean and you feel blessed after the visit.

title: nice and clean lake and so beautiful place
review: it is so nice and clean, so beautiful. We visited in off season so less visitors there. it makes peace full. during our stay we visited it every evening and enjoy lake so much.

title: Peaceful
review: Naina Devi Temple is located at the opposite end of the lake from mall road near Tibbetian Market. It is a good small but very famous temple. You must visit if you are here.

title: Clean and Spiritual
review: This temple is situated just on the bank of the Naini Lake and near the tibetan market. It offers a good panaromic view of the lake and is a must visit in Nainital.

title: A ancient temple worth a visit
review: It's right beside the lake and a ancient temple. There have been lot of stories including Nainital being named after Naina Devi. It's also mentioned in Nainital as one of the Sakti Pith (which is not correct)

title: peace
review: must visit the naina devi temple..

title: Naina Devi Temple…….temple with a history
review: This temple got its name Naina Devi because eye of Goddess Sati fell at this place. This is one of the Shakti Peetha, hence of great religious importance. The ambience of the temple is very beautiful as the temple is surrounded by lake and mountain. One should definitely visit the temple in night as well to witness the beautiful ambience.

title: Must visit if you are Hindu and in Nainital
review: ite religious place to visit near naini lake, try to visit once if you are planning to visit Nainital. along with temple, visit Tibbatiyan market near by.

title: Jai Mata Di
review: The temple is situated at corner of Naini lake. The temple is worshiped by all visitors of Nainital. Well connected and having manageable queue for Darshan

title: Devotional time for Maa Naina Devi
review: Small yet well maintained temple. View of Naina lake from the bank of temple make us to wait and relax for longer time.

title: Naina Devi Temple
review: Naina Devi Temple is located near Tibbetian Market, and the Thandi Sadak. It is a very good temple. We felt the peace in this temple and this temple was not very large.

title: spiritual touch
review: Very beautiful mandir and location. That area is an example of unity of india. In a small square there is a mandir, gurudwara, church and masjid.

title: Serene goddess of the lake
review: Naina devi is a different kind of shakti peeth, here you do not have to face the pundits and maddening crowds that you face at other shakti peeths. Here you can truly find serenity in the simple temple of the goddess and the divine serenity of the lake.

title: Naina Devi
review: A temple, a MIST VISIT, to seek blessings, & a good physical activity to be FIT. A good walk as well.

title: Overhyped
review: Localites gave us conflicting stories about the temple. But it definitely is one of the shakti pith -- where Sati's left eye fell. The view from the temple is just amazing. The temple houses a very small idol, locally believed to have risen from the Nainital lake itself. worth a one time visit for sure.

title: Temple at the bank of Naini Lake
review: It is one of the must visit in Nainital. Very quiet place and provide a good view to Naini lake. Photography is not allowed inside the temple near diety.

title: beautiful temple...
review: its a must visit...the lake besides temple is sooo beautiful...and lots of fish...it looks so nice and pleasant...

title: The must-visit Temple of Nainital!
review: Temple is located in the heart of the town, just next to Naini Lake. Naina Devi Temple shall definitely calm you and is a relaxing experience. Even if you are not particularly religious, a visit here should be on your list. Just outside the temple is the Tibetan Market, where you can indulge in local shopping.

title: Good Place to travel nearby
review: Good place to visit as there is a river bed near by where you can sit & relax. Cold water under your feet makes it amazing experience.

title: Religious and Nice Location
review: Right on the bank of the lake. Good to see the boats, markets and the entire Nainital town from the temple

title: Statue of Hanumanji is great.Looks real Hanumanji standing in from of you.
review: Lake water near the temple is very clean,Can see Bunch of big fishes that are very rare other wise.Team nothing is allowed to be offered that had helped to maintained the cleanliness of the temple.Can offer prayers with the interruption of the priest like in other temples.

title: Very nice temple
review: Very nice and peaceful place. Very much accepted by religion. There is long story behind the temple you may use Google for deepen story, but one who visits nanital must visit temple too especially the married couples.

title: Good place to visit
review: it is a good place to visit,near tibbati market and lake side,the temple is situated on the bank of naini lake.so visit the temple at evening or after sun set so you can view the real beauty of nainital

title: Naina Devi Temple at nanital is at central place in Nanital
review: Visit this temple to see the beauty in nature. The view around is good.

title: Must visit place
review: Place in between of the market and Naini Lake. There is huge street market place to buy stuff. Also you can sit and relax in the temple and enjoy the view.

title: Devotee
review: I love the view of lake from Naina devi, she has given me the power, the view from the Naina devi is excellent. From there you can go to Tibetian market for local shopping.

title: jai mata di
review: The temple is located on one end of the lake at Malli tal ( the other end is called talital). It has the deity overlooking the lake and is indeed a serene location. when we visited the temple in the early morning there were hardly any devotees and we got a very good darshan. The view of the lake from the temple is breathtaking.

title: Very nice temple
review: This temple...adjacent to naini lake, is very well maintained and clean. Not so crowdy.

title: Attend aarti if possible
review: Good temple...adjacent to naini lake. Attend aarti if possible. Its good. The view from the temple is great as well.

title: boat ride to the naina devi temple
review: during our boat ride in naini lake we decided to get to the naina devi temple.nice visit to the to the temple just one day before the navratri sthapna was like "mother calling".nice temple with a great view of the lake

title: Jai Mata Di
review: Pay your respect to the Goddess Naina Devi in this tranquil place. Temple also offers great views of the Naina Lake and surroundings. Trip is incomplete without the Chocolate Barfi parshad. Temple is also next to the Tibetian Market, which offers great collection of clothes at unbeatable prices.

title: Temple next to lake
review: This is place to must visit. Apart from visiting the goddess, there  is a magnificent view of the town across the lake. The place is fresh and nice.

title: Naina devi temple
review: On banks of the lake with a clear view . We had brilliant sunshine on early wintery morning and had a good darshan.

title: yeah it is good
review: well to be frank i dont believe in god much...but i love the sweets there.the place has its own beaty and elegance.ppl come here to get the valuable blessings of nainadevi

title: Beauty of Nainital - Goddess Naina Devi
review: An experience in itself, Temple just next to Naini Lake provides a magnificent view of a lake.

title: Search for Peace of Mind
review: Search for Peace of Mind ends here. With the Blessing of Naina Devi one feel afresh in life. She takes all your sorrows and pain.

title: peaceful darshan
review: on one side of the lake, the small and peaceful temple is located. one of the shaktipeeths the temple is of much importance for a devout hindu.

title: excellent
review: very good  temple with excellent location ,  nainital has excellent religious structure ,with being a temple , mosque , gurudwara  at one location

title: Place of peace and beauty
review: Though near by a crowded market, the place is ideal for worship...a peaceful location, Naini lake on one side..A temple worth visiting

title: big point,
review: big point where you will get the mata sati temple, which is called naina devi temple on the lake. so beautiful, wonderful.

title: Good place for worship...
review: A place where you feel peace and shanti all around..Doing Darshan There might change your feelings...local market avilable there for shopping..

title: For the religiously inclined
review: This is a great place to visit when in Nanital. Highly significant and located right on the banks of Naini lake.

title: Famous temple
review: This is a must  visit temple for tourists devoted to Goddess Naina  Devi.The idols of Goddesses are b'ful and  there are  other Gods also.Situated by the  side of Naini lake it  offers good view of the lake also.There is  a sikh gurudwara and a Masjid not too far from here.First thing we did on reaching Ntal was to pay obeisance at the temple.

title: NICE TEMPLE
review: We recently visited this temple on our visit of nainital.Though it was heavvily raining we carried umbrella and it was worth visiting.The temple is almost at end of main lake.There is a breif history that parvathis eyes fallen at this place.A good temple with good greenary and lake in the back round.A must visit in nainital

title: Evening Aarti
review: Around 1900 hrs is the Aarti time and its great to be there at that time. There are few restaurant are there near the temple. China Town, although not very hygienic, was the busiest one over there.

title: Roof Top temple
review: We had an visit with our school friends there in the very younger days of my life,I still remember It was an amazing tracking and rock climbing over the river at end of the lake situated at Top Most side of the river,There is huge greenery all around temple and an amazing scenic view towards entire city from the top ,One must should have visit the temple.

title: divine place nice temple at naini bank
review: it is really nice experience visiting the temple located at the center of nainital nearby the ground and bank of the naini lake. you ll enjoy the spiritually flowing in the air around you.

title: Divine Blessings
review: The temple is located at the end of the lake towards Mallital and the approach towards Thandi Sadak starts from here. There is a Gurudwara adjoining to it and a mosque stands on the opposite side. The lane/approach from Mall Road to the Temple & Thandi Sadak is fully encroached by vendors and has a "Bazaar" like feeling as if you are going trough a market but once inside, it is very well maintained & neat & clean. The view of the lake is awesome from here.

title: Peace of Mind
review: Feels good to visit this temple. On your visit, definitely read the history and importance of Naina Devi temple.

title: Lake edge
review: It is on the edge of the lake and a very serene place.the idols really attract.also the shops outside the temple are nice.

title: peaceful abode of goddess
review: I attended the AARTI at the temple of naina devi beside the lake.. it was enchanting with its glory..

title: Jai Mata Di
review: This beautiful temple is located at one corner of the naini lake.If  you are staying in Mall road then no need to book any vehicle as you can easily walk to the temple.There is one beautiful Mosque and one Gurudwara on the way to the temple besides the local market.The precinct of the temple is clean and from here there is a good view of the city.Watch the evening aarti  and the fishes in the lake.

title: Excellent lakeside temple
review: Visited at sunset...always pleasant and cool being next to the lake..we had a very good visit and darshan..worth a visit as this is just adjacent to the boating place and then proceed to the tibetean market for shopping..

title: old and beautiful temple of Goddess Durga
review: its an old and beautiful temple situated besides naini lake because of this temple the town got its name as nainital. Its a very ancient temple of Goddess Durga mainly and it is told that the 'eye' of 'sati' falled here because of which this temple got its name as 'naina devi' temple and it is one of the shaktipeeths.

title: How Nainital got its name?
review: We have visited Naintal several times, but had never seen the temple. This time, our cab driver suggested that we visit the temple. Overlooking the lake, this is a small temple, where you have to climb a few steps to reach the temple and have Ma's blessings. There are just a few shops which sell offerings and we bought a puja thali from one of them. While we were at the temple, the shopkeeper took care of our belongings. He was also selling small brass bells. There is also a place in the temple where you can tie small chunnis and make mannats (wishes) to the mother and you have to return and untie one when your wish is fulfilled. We were wondering why we had never visited the temple before. There are also small eating joints near the parking. This time we were not hungry, but on some visit I remember having nice Dosas at one of these.

title: Beautiful Naini Devi
review: This temple is very beautiful beside the Naini lake. It was clean and well maintained with lots of potted plants.

title: Not to miss
review: Naina devi temple is on the mall road and naini lake. lovely temple of powerfull goddess durga maa. The temple also has some beautiful background for clicking pics.

title: Jai Devi...
review: The temple is located on the northern shore of Naini lake. The presiding deity of the temple is Maa Naina Devi represented by two Netras or eyes. Flanking Naina Devi are the deities of Mata Kali and Lord Ganesha. Nainital is believed to be one of the 64 Shaktipeeths, where one of the body parts of Goddess Sati fell, when Lord Shiva carried her body. In Nainital, the eyes (naina) of the Goddess are assumed to have fallen. The shrine of Naina Devi is a must visit for devout Hindus. and was reconstructed after being destroyed in the 1880 landslide. One can also get an amazing view of the hill station, overlooking the lake, from the temple.

title: lots of colourful fishes
review: located on northern side of lake, the temple is quite lovely. it has nice view of lake and presents a classic place for photo ops. but, what i like most was the huge school of colorful fishes that come near the temple where devotees feed them it seems, quite usually.

title: Good temple
review: Nice temple to visit. Near by you have got local market. Though the products sold over there are bought from Delhi, still you can buy some sovenier. I bought some decorative item made out of pine.

title: Nice temple to visit
review: Beautiful and just in front of the lake, nice to walk among the gods and godess, enjoy the view, and make a pray!

title: Preserves he History
review: The Nainia Devi Temple is as old as Nainital itself. It gives you a divine feeling to visit this temple which overlooks the Naina Lake. The temple is small and simple but it preserves within itself the history of this hill station. You cant miss a visit to this temple if you are in Nainital

title: What a View
review: The temple is great, and the view from the temple towards the other end of the city is wonderfull, best time to visit is after 6 pm, when sun is setteling down, and you get a perfect photo spot

title: good place
review: Go there to get worship in local area.Also visit market near by there along with thandi sadak.Very near to mall road adds a plus for it.

title: A beautiful temple on the lake front surrounded by tibbetan market
review: A beautiful temple and one should visit here for sure. One can also  walk ahead to Pashan Devi temple as well as they say whatever you wish in that temple is fulfilled.

title: Beautiful Temple at Naini lake
review: Very clean temple at Naini lake. It is very famous temple of Nainital. There is local big market near to the temple. Many things are available worth purchasing at affordable rates. It was great feel to overlook Naini lake while being at the temple.

title: Peaceful and Serene
review: The temple area is clean , and it brings a calmness into you while visiting the place, good place to sit back and collect your thoughts

title: Peace of Mind
review: There are 6 Deities in the temple premises if I am not mistaken and the feel in the temple is very refreshing.

title: Beautiful Temple for Mother Naina Devi next to the lake
review: This place of Mother is beautiful. We went to the temple during the aarthi time at night. The temple and the surroundings had lovely decoverative lights. Mother Saraswathi was also seated there. There are sannathis for Kal Bhairavji, Shivji and Ganeshji. Pandits offered Mother’s prasad. The time we visited was less crowded, hence, quite and serene. We enjoyed the visit to the temple and felt Mother’s love in our hearts.

title: Nice Temple
review: Its a nice temple near Nini lake & Tibbeti Market. Goddess is assumed to be very powerful. You can feed fishes in the naini lake from the temple boundry. Very nice place

title: Very Old temple, well maintained.
review: The name of the place Nainital is derived from the temple of goddess Naina Devi. Its a nice clean temple on the banks of the Nainital lake.

title: No one to hassle you
review: Although it is regarded as one of the few must visit shrines, it is devoid of hustler's coaxing you to make offerings etc. You can walk around and pay your respect take exterior photo's etc without anyone bothering you.

title: Divine
review: The Temple is one of the finest spots of Nainital. The Name Naintal, I presume has been derived from Godess Naina Devi of  this temple. The Temple is located on one of corners of the lake, which has a beautiful view of the entire lake. The temple has a beautiful Shivlinga in the premises which gives a divine experience to the visitors who worship here. The temperature here is always cool because of the lake. During the evenings it is much cooler and the trust of the temple takes proper care of the devotees by laying carpet in the premises of the temple. This is one of the most beautiful temples which should not be missed by anyone visiting Nainital. This place has to  be experienced once, it is very difficult to express its beauty in words.

title: Pious evening
review: Its was an awesome experience to be in the temple in the evening aarti..  The lake and the sound of those big bells mesmerises you.

title: Nainital's Soul
review: Naina Devi temple is on the shore of Nainital Lake. It has very serene temple surroundings. Visiting this place gives you peace of mind. Your trip won't be completed unless you visit this temple. Infact the first thing I do everytime going to Nainital is to visit Maa Naina Devi temple. Must visit!! You can go boating from this side of lake also.

title: Where eyes of Devi falls
review: As per mythology, it is  believed that the eyes of Sati dropped in the lake while her body was being carried by Lord Shiva to Kailesh mountain. Hence, the lake was given the name of 'Nainital' or Naini lake. Later the spot became famous by this very name. Naina Devi is considered to be one of the most revered Hindu temples in India. It is situated on the northern shore of Naini Lake and very attractive.

title: the temple
review: beautiful temple in the vicinity of a mosque, a gurudwara, and the naini lake. the tibetan market is enroute to the temple, and it offers an opportunity to buy useful goods during the stay.

title: Clean Temple
review: Never seen so well managed temple. Very clean, organised and ideally located. Must visit. Close to Naini lake.

title: Jai Matadi
review: its a very beautiful good temple of Devi Naini on the bank of Naini lake in Nainital . Well mentained beautiful clean temple. Must visit when you are at Nainital.

title: Naina Devi Mandir
review: The temple is very famous for worshipers who wish for something and come back after blessed with his wish. I have come across many such stories and have true belief in this. I am one of those blessed with Naina Devi's blessings.

title: Loved the temple
review: It is situated at the far end of Naini Lake commonly known as Malli Tal and adjacent to it is Bhutia market. The view of Naini Lake is marvelous. Not so much crowded.

title: Must visit in Nainital
review: If you visit Nanital you must surely visit Naina Devi Temple. You can  buy a pooja thali from outside the temple. Do light incense sticks and don't forget to take the prasad from the pundit. Just outside Naina Devi temple are small shack like shops selling Tibetan and Chinese stuff and Indian stuff too. I liked the Pahari Shop a lot.

title: Must visit temple.
review: A good temple and a must visit,

title: Very nice
review: I liked it very much, it just right by the lake, next to the bhotia market. Very beautiful.  We had to take off shoes and then walk around. The view was even more beautiful on the lake.

title: True essence of Nainital!!
review: Your tour to Nainital would never be complete without visiting this place..you could see the whole town from this lakeside temple..right in the market but still so calm and serene.. 'Naina Devi Temple'- a must visit place in Nainital.

title: Goddess Naina temple
review: The naina temple is located in the mall road and adjacent to naina lake. Its very beautiful and i liked the surroundings views is the evenings...

title: shakti peeth
review: Temple is small and located near the lake with good views. The place is very serene and peacefull. The place is one of the shakti peeths in India and one can have a nice spiritual experience after visiting it.

title: Peaceful place amidst the hustle and bustle of the market area
review: The Naina Devi temple is located in the vicinity of the mall road... and the Tibetan market. With so many options of food and shopping outside, one can easily make the mistake of forgetting to visit the place that the essence of Nainital - The Naina Devi Temple.

title: Shakti devi temple next to a lake
review: Naina Devi temple in Nainitaal is a simple and beautiful lake side Shakti devi temple complex. There are many temples within the complex primary one being "Goddess Naina Devi". As per local legend, Nainitaal was formed out of tear droplets from the eye (Nain) of Goddess Parvathi.

title: Temple with a view
review: Nainital gets its name because of this temple situated at one end of Naini Lake.Small temple with a beautiful view of the lake.There are shops around this temple which sell some pretty good stuff be it sweets,snacks or electronics,clothes ,they have everything in those small shops.
